posts.post_text: August 5, 2016 at 4:55 PM#4the Addvar function does string concat if the variable is a string, and mathematical addition withdecimal valuesif the variable is a number.the grandMA2 commandlinesyntax usesdot-seperated valuesfor e.g. executorsx.y = page x executor ythe dot separates two different integer values:e.g.1.2 is the value 1 and the value 22.30 is the value 2 and the value 30in this system e.g. 1.003 and 1.3 is the same: two integer values, value 1 and value 3in thedecimal systemthe dot seperates whole numbers from decimal numbersin this system e.g. 1.300 and 1.3 is the same: one value 1.3to use addvar with dot-separated values, you need to keep them separatedSetuservar $showcolpage=10SetUserVar $showcolexe = 101 ; SetUserVar $showcolexe2 = 1132; Assign Sequence 1 Thru 13 At Executor $showcolpage.$Showcolexe Thru Executor $showcolexe2/o3; AddUserVar $showcolexe2 = 24; Assign Macro 226 At Executor $showcolpage.$showcolexe2 /o
